postcontent:
I have a DPMS Panther in great condition that I'm looking to trade. As stated it's a DPMS Panther, has a carbine length gas system, 1:9 twist on the barrel and is chambered for both 5.56/.223.  It has a brand new, and as of yet, unfired on, set of matching OD green Magpul furniture, but it will also include the factory DPMS stock if wanted, as well as a quad rail and vertical foregrip.  Didn't like the look or feel of the quad rail personally which is why I went with the Magpul, but everyone's tastes are different.  Will come with iron sights and a brand new 4x scope, nothing special about it but its very solid and seems to be reliable.
Will also include 6 mags, 4 metal 30 round mags, 1 30 round Magpul mag and 1 20 round magpul mag.  I also have 270 rounds of ammo, 220 rounds of steel case .223 and 50 rounds of Hornady Vmax.

I've got about $1000 into the package, but I'm mainly looking to trade.  I love the Springfield XD platform so I'm primarily interested in an XDm 9mm of any size+cash, ammo, extra mags or an assortment of the three.  I already have an XD40 so not interested in another one and I'm not looking for a .45 right now.  Might consider an XD9 service+cash and/or ammo, but I havent had an XDm yet, so that's what I'm mostly interested in.  I've been looking for something pocket sized for summer carry such as a Kel Tec Pf9 or P3AT, Ruger LCP, Beretta Nano or something similar as well, so would consider an XD along with something in this class.  Not interested in other rifles or shotguns for trades.

I've been wanting to get into reloading for a long time too so would be interested in a COMPLETE reloading setup (presses, turrets, dies, measures, tumblers, etc)+cash or firearms to even out a deal.

The ONLY non firearm related trade I would consider would be for a motorcycle, looking for something along the lines of a Kawasaki Ninja 500 or 600 or an older metric cruiser 750cc's or larger. title: For Sale:  POF NP3 415 Piston 14.5" Upper chambered in VERY RARE 6.8 SPC II **LIKE NEW** (lmt, lwrc, sig, hk, pws, hogan, trijicon, eotech)
postcontent: Very rare 6.8 SPC II upper, have only ever seen a few POF rifles chambered in this round and even fewer with the super short 14.5" pinned barrel. POF no longer makes the 6.8 SPC uppers, only 5.56 and .308, so get it while you still can! This gas piston driven upper has less than 100 rds thru it and is in excellent condition. Fluted barrel is easily capable of sub-moa accuracy and will last at least 20-30k rnds or more. Piston-driven gas system keeps hot, dirty gases out of the chamber for longer life, more reliability, and less cleaning.  Compatible with any mil-spec AR15 lower, just pull the pins on your lower, drop it in, throw in a full mag, and it's ready to rock and roll. Upper receiver and BCG are coated in NP3 finish which needs little to no lubrication and cleans with the wipe of a rag, no solvents needed. Fully legal 14.5" fluted barrel with a pinned flash suppressor and full monolithic tactical POF P-11SX quad rail. This is the perfect round for hunting or self-defense, offering a compact package close to the size of 5.56, but with the knockdown power close to a .308 Win. You cannot buy a more accurate, reliable, or higher quality upper than POF anywhere! Also have the matching NP3 lower which I might be talked into selling. Can email additional pics upon request. Willing to accept credit card payment thru discreet Paypal transaction. No FFL needed, can be shipped right to your door!

title: For Sale:  Seekins Precision Billet Lower w/Ambi Bolt Release
postcontent:
The SP 223 Billet lower feature a unique design geared towards the serious tactical shooter. The oversized winter trigger guard, quick access mag release, beveled mag well, ambi bolt drop and user friendly features make this lower the best on the market. To ease assembly Seekins Precision eliminated the use of roll pins, hammers, punches and replaced them with custom screw in dowel pins. We installed an upper tensioning set screw, a set screw for trigger reset, relocated and retained the rear take down pin detent under the grip. Our ambidextrous bolt control allows the shooter to quickly drop the bolt or from either side of the firearm. The unique magwell design allows positive mag changes and allows the use of most all mags including Magpul P-mag and Surefire high capacity mags.

title: For Sale:  Saiga .410 Tubular Converted
postcontent:
This is a new Saiga 410 conversion. It has a 22" barrel. The FCG has been moved forward and a US Made FCG has been installed. We have re-profiled and polished this FCG to enhance the performance and reliability of the gun. A new Trigger Guard has been installed and modified to fit the New Hogue grip. A Tromix Oversize Charging Knob has been installed. The trigger pull is approx 4.5 lbs. but we can lower it some more at minimal cost. 19" barrel. A new Aluminum fore grip made for us and powder coated has been installed. Rails can be attached at the 3, 6 and 9 o'clock positions at slight increase in cost. An Over Molded Hogue Grip was installed. A Mag Release extension was also added to facilitate operating the gun without taking your hand off of the pistol grip. Paint has been touched up with a solvent resistant Ceramic based paint.

The rear tang has been removed and the rear of the receiver has been reshaped and an internal support block has been installed to support the ACE PB Hinge and the Tromix Skeleton stock. I remove the tang in order to not have to use external mounting blocks that extend the length of the gun. An after market recoil spring was also added to aid in reliability.

Fire the gun, release a mag, lock open the bolt, all without taking your hand off the pistol grip. The gun comes with all factory included parts, a 5 round mag, tools, papers and it's box.  This gun is fully 922R compliant even if using the factory mag.( IT'S ONE HELL OF A SHOTGUN ). Please contact me if you're interested. Thank you for looking.

The barrel is original. The receiver has most of a Nazi waffenampt on the left side below the serial number. It is chambered in 8mm. This comes as shown in sporter configuration. The stock has been fit fairly decently to the action. The receiver has been drilled and has a scope bases mounted to it with an old 3-9 power adjustable scope. This is a shooter and we are told by our consignor it is an accurate rifle. The bore is a little dark but the rifling is strong. The bolt and receiver have matching serial numbers. 

Priced at $300.00 with sales tax included. Shipping is available. Local trades welcome. Must be 18yrs or older and pass a background check. 

Stop Drop & Shop, Your Pawnshop Alternative. Where you can buy, sell and trade almost anything. 3920 N. Academy. Colorado Springs, CO 80917. 10am-6pm Mon-Fri & 10am-5pm Sat. REDACTED

title: For Sale:  Beautiful Condition 1917 Remington Armory WW1 Rifle (RARE MAKE!)
postcontent: This model of REMINGTON ARMORY USA MILITARY Rifle was only made for 2 years (1916-1917) in this ordinance (7.62 x 54) to supply aid to the Russian Army in WW1. They were withheld at the Armory with the outbreak of the Russian Revolution in 1917. This rifle has all matching numbers on ALL of the components - Russian Exchange stamp , insignia and markings on the Hex receiver are all there ,also. The bore is shiney-clean and it shoots like new!  Own a cool piece of WW1 History for $425.00 !

title: For Sale:  Czech Vz35 WWII Training Rifle
location: Story City, IA, Des Moines, Iowa
postcontent: Original 1935 vintage Vz35 WWII training rifle duplicating the weight, length, action, sights, & set-up of the German Mauser 98 8mm...  including Czech crest & bayonet stud (neither present on reproduction model Vz47), however this was produced as a 4.5 mm BB gun (.177/17 cal) so as not to violate the Versailles Treaty of WW I.  (so the sights are calibrated for 5, 10, 15, 20, & 25 yds.)  This rifle is in excellent condition tho it has been cleaned & freshened up (the stock re-coated for protection of the wood) with a dull-oil finish to duplicate the original.  It was not sanded, so the stock retains it's original dings & divots from the past.  The metal parts exhibit some surface rust, and likewise has been cleaned-up and re-oiled for protection, but not re-blued, so it retains it's original finish.  The receiver bears the Czechoslovakian crest, as well as the mfr's. markings:  Mfr.--  "Ceska Zbrojovka", the gunmaker/designer (?)--  "A.B. Praze", the model: "Vz35", and the serial No.: "2291".  This is a fully functioning and accurate weapon--  In fact, I found it being used as a "pest-control gun" by a retired, local farmer; and, have shot it several times myself, including just yesterday (2/24/14), laying 10 shots (off-hand) in a quarter-sized group at 8 yds., with the BBs virtually, fully penetrating the 8 layers of my bullet trap.  I have seen  similar examples of this gun listed on Gunbroker for $500 and $600, and have read blogs discussing the actual sale of another similarly described example for $450, and yet another lesser one for $400...  I am asking $450, but am also open to consider other reasonable offers. (mfr. & cal. below are as close as I could get... as "BB guns"/air rifles are not reflected here)

I paid $640+tax for the gun, 

The gun has around 500 rounds through it, and I also installed a "D" spring, which is the hammer spring from the DAO model that drops the DA/SA trigger weights from around 12/6 to closer to 8/5.

I still have the stock spring if for some reason you choose to reinstall it, as well as an extra "D" spring that I will include with the gun.

When I bought the gun new, after I got it home I notcied it had a few "dings" around the muzzle-end, I looked it up online and this is a fairly common issue with Beretta.

It is just through the Bruniton finish and stops at the parkerizing underneath.

It's not very noticable, just mentioning it for full disclosure. I included pictures. I'm sure a touch-up pen would take care of it, I just didn't have one. Armslist only let me upload 3 pictures, if you want more of the muzzle end I'll text them to you before we set up a meeting.

Also have 350 rounds of FMJ's I will throw in for 50 if you buy the gun.

No trades, located in Russellville and don't want to drive further than Conway or Fort Smith to meet up. LOCAL SALES ONLY, WILL NOT SHIP.

Thanks for looking.
